text: have you ever had a salmon patty or a
salmon burger when I was growing up my
dad used to make salmon patties for us
for dinner out of CAM salmon and they
were so delicious I was a little
inspired by his recipe for this recipe
this is a gingery salmon burger using
fresh salmon to start off with to get it
ginger you'll need three tablespoons of
minced ginger peel it with the side of a
thin spoon if you can you can also use a
vegetable peeler but I think this works
really well and is quite efficient to
mince just cut across the fibers so the
fibers were on the lengthwise I'm cut
into little strips and then the strip's
get cut crosswise into the minutes okay
that looks good and that's plenty of
ginger you also need a third of a cup of
minced chives if you can't find chives
you can use the green part of scallions
or you can skip it all together and
replace it with parsley or another herb
that you like looks good to me
now because we're making these burgers
and we're gonna serve them on burger
buns I'm using another burger bun to
make the bread crumbs to bind these
together so take one burger bun and
grind it up in a food processor
as usual a stray piece that didn't grind
up that's okay
you're gonna coat your burgers with some
of these crumbs and some of them are
gonna go inside to bind it this is a
pound of skinless salmon it's been cut
into 1-inch pieces pulse the salmon
until its course it's easy for fish to
get overworked so pulsing it's perfect
here check every once in a while use one
or two more pulses and then you can
transfer it back into the bowl to
combine with the remaining ingredients
so then add a third of a cup of those
breadcrumbs save the rest to coat the
burgers a tablespoon of Dijon mustard
1/3 of a cup of the chives and then 3
tablespoons of ginger a teaspoon of
coarse salt and about 1/4 teaspoon of
black pepper stir all of this together
don't over mix it but you want to make
sure that it's fully combined and also
distribute all those flavorings
throughout the burgers divided into four
this makes four burgers and then form
into patties and then you coat them in
these breadcrumbs I like to use the
breadcrumbs to finish forming them and
then you can just sort of push them
aside well as you do the rest of them if
the mixture is very sticky you could put
it into the refrigerator for a few
minutes you can dampen your hands those
are all things that will help you have
the burger mixture not stick to your
hands if you're finding it overly sticky
now of course you're gonna want to wash
your hands before you start cooking took
up them you want a nonstick skillet and
a couple tablespoons of olive oil then
transfer your patties to the pan they
need to cook for about four minutes per
side it depends on how thick you've made
them but you want them golden brown on
the outside and opaque throughout turn
them over carefully and then just cook
the other side same thing golden brown
when they're cooked through you can
remove them and drain them just briefly
if you want to on some paper towels just
to remove a little bit of the excess fat
and then serve them up like any burger
I'm gonna serve mine on a bun with some
mayo and just a little bit of lettuce
but put whatever you want on them wasabi
mayo would be kind of cool here I think
a little bit of lettuce burger on top
nice huh
really fresh delicious super quick to
whip up and I think a really nice and
fresh take on one of my old favorites
mmm the ginger you're gonna love it
